Package au.edu.anu.rscs.aot.environment

Class Environment

java.lang.Object
au.edu.anu.rscs.aot.environment.Environment
Direct Known Subclasses:
LocalEnvironment
public abstract class Environment extends Object
A class to record the running environment of a java application, e.g. operating system, user name, number of CPUs, current directory, etc. Most of the file operations are now redundant with the FileUtils package. It may be used to represent a local environment or a remote environment, for applications running processes on multiple computers.
Author:
Shayne Flint - before 27/2/2012

    • makeAbsolutePath

      public String makeAbsolutePath​(String... pathElement)
      Constructs a path name from its arguments and test if it represents an absolute path name in the operating system. If not, set it into the current working directory.
      Parameters:
      pathElement - a list of path elements (i.e. OS-compatible names)
      Returns:
      the full name of the created file / directory

    • makePath

      public String makePath​(String... pathElements)
      Constructs a OS-independent path from its arguments. Has no effect on the file system, i.e. this is just String manipulation. Ignores empty and null Strings in its arguments.
      Parameters:
      pathElements - a list of path elements (i.e. OS-compatible names)
      Returns:
      the full path name

    • makeFile

      public File makeFile​(String... pathElement)
      Constructs a path name from its arguments and test it is a valid file / directory name for the operating system.
      Parameters:
      pathElement - a list of path elements (i.e. OS-compatible names)
      Returns:
      the created file / directory
